name: Card 0
action: After looking at examples of architectural photography, document your own library, focusing on positive + negative space, color + pattern, and detail. Compare your images with colleagues. Do people see the same space?

name: Card 1
action: Identify a space in your library where labor is hidden (think book processing, cataloging, etc.). Photograph this space as it is being used by library staff through a doorway. Find a similarly shaped space in the library that is vulnerable or revealing. Print this photograph to scale and hang.

name: Card 2
action: Take photos of spaces in the library where you are completely alone, absent from the presence of any other individual in the library [space]. Take 3 photos of yourself in 3 different places. Be stealthy; be quick; creep quietly.

name: Card 3
action: Photograph every perceived barrier in your space (physical and otherwise).

name: Card 4
action: Identify the spaces where patrons gather the most and the least. Photograph all the similarities of those spaces where people congregate such as furniture, pathways, even materials. Make a list of words these photographs evoke.

name: Card 5
action: Find small objects around the library [space] and photograph them exactly how and where you found them. Maybe someone dropped something? Create an exhibition of your photos.
